column5: Yesterday I went to Bowmanville to volunteer for the fish lift.  Little did I know that it got canceled at the last minute so I drove out there for nothing.  The river was packed with fish just south of the dam and there were multiple snaggers around.  But what pi$$ed me off was that I saw a relatively young asian man using one of those huge tuna lifting poles (essentially a huge hook attached to a long broom handle) to pierce fish at the side of the river and drag them into his stupid ice cooler.  So after running for the cops at happened to just drive by, I came back to my spot and caught him in the act of poaching more innocent salmon out of the river.  I confronted him and let the F words fly.  He played all dumb ("me no speak English, me sorry") but I had no patience for it.  After yelling at him and telling him to get the hell out of the creek or he'll be under arrest  I went back to his ice cooler and dumped his entire catch back into river and threw the cooler in the dirt path.  He left and didn't come back.  I was extremely angry at this dude and had to save myself from kicking his a$$ on the spot.

Take my word here - don't be a superhero.  Don't get me wrong, you have the right intentions except your execution is a bit off unless you are ready to go face to face with a knife wielding snagger then everything is good.  Call the cops or MNR and let them deal with it.
